intro: Clerodendrum serratum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy flame bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange, often resembling flames. The plant has palmately lobed leaves that are covered with fine, hairy pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants.
